publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1474# Janis Hughes: Acute Health Service Review in South Glasgow-That the Parliament notes the current review of acute hospital services in the south of Glasgow and believes that there should be an option appraisal of all the sites considered by Greater Glasgow Health Board as part of their consultation process. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mike Watson*, Robert Brown*, John Young*

S1M-1474# Janis Hughes: Acute Health Service Review in South Glasgow-That the Parliament notes the current review of acute hospital services in the south of Glasgow and believes that there should be an option appraisal of all the sites considered by Greater Glasgow Health Board as part of their consultation process. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mike Watson, Robert Brown, John Young
S1M-1474# Acute Health Service Review in South Glasgow (lodged on 14 December 2000) Alex Neil*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1474# Acute Health Service Review in South Glasgow (lodged on 14 December 2000) Pauline McNeill*

S1M-1474# Janis Hughes: Acute Health Service Review in South Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the current review of acute hospital services in the south of Glasgow and believes that there should be an option appraisal of all the sites considered by Greater Glasgow Health Board as part of their consultation process. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mike Watson, Robert Brown, John Young, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Pauline McNeill
S1M-1474# Acute Health Service Review in South Glasgow (lodged on 14 December 2000) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-1474# Acute Health Service Review in South Glasgow (lodged on 14 December 2000) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1474# Janis Hughes: Acute Health Service Review in South Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the current review of acute hospital services in the south of Glasgow and believes that there should be an option appraisal of all the sites considered by Greater Glasgow Health Board as part of their consultation process. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mike Watson, Robert Brown, John Young, Alex Neil, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Pauline McNeill, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan
